result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob M Mason

defendant.name: Mason, Jacob M

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob M Mason in court in person, out of custody.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court in person for Jacob M Mason.  Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Scheduling Conference. Defense Counsel requests a new date for a Plea Hearing. Matter is adjourned.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Jacob M Mason in court in person.  Attorney Kevin Gaertner on behalf of Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court in person for Jacob M Mason.  Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Scheduling Conference. Defense Counsel requests more time to review discovery and obtain report from medical evaluation. State objects, is ready to proceed with Trial dates. Defense Counsel  requests that the matter be adjourned for the appointed Counsel to address. Court grants the motion. Matter is adjourned.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob M Mason
Current: 4036 W Lake View Dr., Franklin, WI 53132 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2022)
Prior: 1620 South 90th Street #4, West Allis, WI 53214

Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Jacob M Mason.  Attorney Michael Schindhelm formEmily S Zimmel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense has received discovery and is in the process of viewing it.  Defense needs to set up a time to meet with the detective.  Defense request another scheduling conference.  State stipulate to the request.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.

Defendant Jacob M Mason in court with attorney Noah Buhle for Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Alicia H Kort for Emily Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties stipulate to an adjournment.  Defense has not received an offer or discovery.

Defendant remains in compliance with JusticePoint.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, received and filed.

Defendant Jacob M Mason in court with Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Remaining cash bail to be returned to remitter. 
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision Level 5. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court. IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jacob M Mason in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 07/14/2022@1pm
